message: I'm offering you a premium product that's been thoroughly inspected and tested. It's a rare opportunity to get your hands on a high-quality item that's worth $400 to you. I'm only asking for $100, which is a steal considering its value. I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere. What do you say? Will you take advantage of this offer?
I'm not going to fall for the sales pitch. I'll pass on this one.

I understand you're cautious, and that's a smart approach. Let me give you some additional context: I've already sold several of these products to other customers, and they've all been extremely satisfied with their purchases. This product has been thoroughly vetted and guaranteed to meet the highest standards. I'm willing to offer it to you for the same price as the others, $100. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not sure when I'll have another opportunity to make a deal like this. What do you think?
I appreciate the additional context, but I'm not convinced. I'll pass on this one as well.

I understand you're still hesitant, and I respect that. Let me ask you a question: what's the opportunity cost of passing on this deal? Are you willing to potentially miss out on a product that could bring you significant value for just $100? It's a risk-free opportunity to get a high-quality product at a fraction of its true value. What do you think?
I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm still not convinced. I'll pass on this one.
